Returns: the final response to the request. This is never an intermediate response with status code 1xx.
Parameters: the target host for the request. Implementations may accept null if they can still determine a route, for example to a default target or by inspecting the request.
the context for executing the request
Throws: in case of an IO problem or if the connection was aborted
execute(org.apache.http.HttpHost, org.ap.Description: Executes a request. HttpMethodDirector in HttpClient 3.
execute(org.apache.http.HttpHost, org.ap.FullName: public abstract HttpResponse execute (HttpHost target, HttpRequest request, HttpContext context)

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit A client-side request director. The director decides which steps are necessary to execute a request. It establishes connections and optionally processes redirects and authentication challenges. The director may therefore generate and send a sequence of requests in order to execute one initial request.
